name: Debt Dilemma
title: Highest Public Debt from Bonds
description: In 2023, Brazil's public debt from bonds reached $3,396,044,000, the highest in the world, indicating significant financial obligations.

name: Frugal Spending
title: Lowest Goods and Services Expense
description: In 2023, Brazil allocated only 2.41% of its expenses to goods and services, the lowest globally, reflecting a minimalistic approach to spending.

name: Savings Shortfall
title: Negative National Savings
description: In 2021, Brazil's adjusted net national savings were negative, amounting to -$15,896,717,478, highlighting a concerning lack of savings.

name: Welfare Warriors
title: High Adequacy of Unemployment Benefits
description: In 2022, Brazil's unemployment benefits and active labor market programs accounted for 27.07% of total welfare for beneficiary households, showcasing strong social support.

name: Youth Workforce Woes
title: High Child Employment in Study and Work
description: In 2015, 95.96% of Brazilian children aged 7-14 were engaged in both study and work, the highest globally, indicating a significant child labor issue.

name: Family Helpers
title: High Unpaid Child Family Workers
description: In 2015, 63.7% of children in employment were unpaid family workers, reflecting a reliance on child labor within families.

name: Minimal Child Labor
title: Low Child Employment in Work Only
description: In 2015, only 4.04% of children aged 7-14 were engaged solely in work, indicating a relatively low rate of exclusive child labor.
